snippet: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he actually make a difference?
abstract: Sub-prime Chicago neighborhood of Roseland, where a young Barack Obama worked as a community organizer, still suffers from high rates of poverty; neighborhood is a reminder that despite all the actions taken to ease the burden of the poor by the Obama administration, poverty seems to have receded as a national issue; administration says reason for shift in priorities was the economic crisis they inherited.
lead_paragraph: As a young community organizer in Chicago, Barack Obama concluded that to make a real difference, he needed to gain power. But did he actually make a difference?

headline.seo: Roseland, Where Obama the Politician Was Born
headline.main: What Does Obama Really Believe In?
headline.print_headline: The Birthplace of Obama the Politician
